content:
Placeholder for today's meeting 2021-02-09T05:00:00+01:00

Agenda:

  • Triage (as always)
  • Configuration file for lints project needs mentor (preferably not me)
  • _

Got anything else? Just comment below!

I believe the lintcheck tool is mostly feature complete now, we should be able to set up a custom embark_sources.toml that checks all the embark crates (be it git repos or crates.io releases).
It would override the current lintcheck results though but that one is saved in the git repo anyway.
@matthiaskrgr We (embark) can collect a list of repos for you if you need. Can we also run lintcheck in our own private repo so we that we can test our private repos?

@XAMPPRocky if you have a clone of the clippy repo, you can edit
https://github.com/rust-lang/rust-clippy/blob/master/clippy_dev/lintcheck_crates.toml
to only include the crates you want to check.
Then run (in the clippy repo root) cargo dev-lintcheck.
In the end you should see lintcheck-logs/logs.txt with the lint results of the listed crates.
If you commit that, and later rebase and re-run, you should see the log-diff in the repo about new clippy warnings popping up or some old ones disappearing. :)
Not sure what the lintcheck is about exactly, but I have some more crates that are stable-clippy-clean and generally of pretty good quality if that helps.
(maybe there should be README and or some comments in the crates.toml?)
There will probably be merge conflicts if the original logs.txt file gets updated in the meantime, maybe we'll need an option to print to a custom log file...

@Dirkjan Ochtman we could add some of them I guess..? :)
The current selection was mostly me looking at whats interesting/popular on crates.io and what rustc compiles (as a test) in CI.
And yeah, I'll need to add some kind of readme.
Heh, noticed tokei is commented out. Probably around the same I stopped listening to clippy :sweat_smile:
ah right.. tokei-f53c6c99bba5e56b/out/language_type.rs ... it causes 173K clippy::match_same_arms warnings :laughing:

@matthiaskrgr Oh no :sweat_smile: , it shouldn't really be linted, as that's auto-generated by a build script. A lot of those warnings are things like the following. I used to try and deduplicate it, but then I was like "eh, let the compiler figure it out." :smile: 

match language_type {
     LanguageType::Rust => "//",
     LanguageType::C => "//",
}
Meeting in T-15.
Meeting time! :wave:
As always: First item triage. Any remarkable issues or PRs before the sync?

Still waiting on two compiletest-rs PRs to be merged, but not sure who to ping about that. Not sure if Manish has commit access there and if they're available? (context: https://github.com/rust-lang/rust-clippy/issues/5394#issuecomment-770354992)
(I see @Jane Lusby is here. Congrats on the position as colab director :tada: )
I have commit!
This is for the bless command @Philipp Hansch?
yup
Ok, this shouldn't be a sync blocker, should it?
no, I don't think so, it's all internal Clippy tooling

Also @Cameron Steffen @Takayuki Nakata about triaging PRs: Please also ping reviewers if they abandoned a PR for too long to remind them. I saw today, that I should take another look at some PRs I'm assigned to. A reminder now and then would really help.

Otherwise @triagebot end-topic

Does anyone have something to add on the current topic?
React with :working_on_it: if you have something to say.
React with :all_good: if not.
@Philipp Hansch the bless code is just imported from upstream, yes?
Yes, I just added the test-suite thing myself :smiling_face:
Ok next topic. @CPerezz started working on a draft RFC for clippy#6625 (config file for lints). It would be great if someone can mentor this work.

This would involve working out an early draft that we can discuss as a team. So shouldn't be much work. So any volunteers would be appreciated! The draft can be found here: https://hackmd.io/@flip1995/HJteAAPgO
I don't have anything else on this topic, just want to make you guys aware, that this is going on @triagebot end-topic

Does anyone have something to add on the current topic?
React with :working_on_it: if you have something to say.
React with :all_good: if not.
Next @matthiaskrgr noted that the lintcheck tool is now (nearly?) feature complete. Any open questions @matthiaskrgr ?

I tried to add a small readme on how to use it here; https://github.com/rust-lang/rust-clippy/pull/6708/files#diff-21884b161cddd86de6be0873790ac8a0be0401e3d937931cc42ddc405794c78f
(the mega-command is a bit awful to look at though :/ )
it would be nice if we could somehow run this on gha via a cron job daily somehow (maybe in a test repo)
but thats a task for another day I guess

I thought about, if it would make sense to open a separate repository, that just holds a list of crates and the logs. This may simplify the process of adding crates to that repository. People could than just submit a PR to add their crate there.
Yeah I would prefer a separate repo
rust-fuzz has a separate "targets" repo
we don't have a cron job but ... same deal
:+1:
if you have some ideas on what further packages to add to the test-list, let me know :)

The CI could look like this: If someone adds a repo it is tested on CI. and only merged if it passes without warnings. But the CI doesn't run tests on all other repos all the time, soo we don't exhaust GHA.
I think it might be worth to add an alias to cargo (via .cargo/config) for the long command you mentioned is there anything that speaks against this @matthiaskrgr
If we do open a separate repo, should we open it directly in rust-lang org or (first) open it under some user and move it if it's ready @Manish Goregaokar

@xFrednet cargo dev-lintcheck is that command :P
It just does not set a custom crates.toml
https://github.com/rust-lang/rust-clippy/blob/03a0dd599dcb3f3ce7aee844b060a217bd25396b/.cargo/config#L4
Could this be solved by using an environment environment value like uitest does with TESTNAME :thinking:
like LINTCHECK_TOML ?
The last point I have here would be, if we should write a blog post to ask people to submit their repos (once we set up a separate repo)?

matthiaskrgr said:

like LINTCHECK_TOML ?

If it works yes :upside_down:
@flip1995 mmh, I don't know how many projects we will end up with... 100? :sweat_smile:
@flip1995 directly rust-lang
@flip1995 but call it clippy-foo or something
I mean we want as many as possible, I guess.
Hmm, unsure about the blog post but it's probably fine
i'd check with infra if we're okay with soliciting crates for such a thing
Well there already is a big list of rust repos that is used to feed crater runs :) https://github.com/rust-lang/rust-repos
I mean, we want mainly crates, that adhere to Clippy's recommendations. Picking them by hand could be quite difficult.
If we get a lot of crates we could also split them up into a group that runs often and one that only runs per release/sync
also the more repos we add, the more triage will have to be done...
@flip1995 makes sense to me!
We could look into some criteria for crates that can be submitted. E.g. LoC, amount of downloads... to limit the submissions.

But I think we can discuss details offline. Action items:

  • Open repo to run lintcheck on a wider scale
  • find mentor for clippy#6625

@triagebot end-meeting

Does anyone have something to bring up?
React with :working_on_it: if you have something to say.
React with :all_good: if you're ready to end the meeting.

I have one more small update. Last time we had a discussion about assignment of new members to issues. The result was that we want to encourage the usage of @rustbot claim to give a better overview which issue is currently claimed.

I think this has improved over the last two weeks. It's a bit to early to really make a statement but the trend seems to be going up which is great in my opinion :upside_down:
Oh I also have a minor pain point
the nighty that clippy is pinned to atm has a missing rustfmt component which means cargo fmt inside the clippy repo does not work
But I'm not sure how we could avoid that besides not syncing when rustfmt is missing from rustc nightly :/
hmm, something similar happened a few days ago: https://rust-lang.zulipchat.com/#narrow/stream/257328-clippy/topic/Issue.20with.20rustfmt (may not be related though)
(I have to edit the rust-toolchain to use "nightly" every time, run cargo fmt and then check out the original toolchain file again)
I also noticed that. But it is only a problem, because rustfmt is in the rust-toolchain file. Do we really need it there? cargo dev fmt runs latest nightly fmt anyway.

cargo dev fmt runs latest nightly fmt anyway.

oooh
ok I didn't try that :sweat_smile:
So in the fmt test cargo +nightly fmt is run. So just remove rustfmt from rust-toolchain?
https://github.com/rust-lang/rust-clippy/blob/03a0dd599dcb3f3ce7aee844b060a217bd25396b/tests/fmt.rs#L11-L12
guess the worst thing that can happen is that the next sync will have to reformat some code or something :shrug:

I think CI will fail before that happens. And here are the commands that are run by cargo dev fmt: https://github.com/rust-lang/rust-clippy/blob/03a0dd599dcb3f3ce7aee844b060a217bd25396b/clippy_dev/src/fmt.rs#L155-L168
So I think it's save to delete it from rust-toolchain. Let me do that real quick and see what CI thinks about it.
CI may not work right now :sweat_smile: https://www.githubstatus.com/incidents/5qdkkyg958vy

But I think, that's really it for the meeting.

Thanks for attending :wave:
